advancedPawn.name: Advanced pawn
advancedPawn.description: One of your pawns is deep into the opponent position, maybe threatening to promote.

advantage.name: Advantage
advantage.description: Seize your chance to get a decisive advantage. (200cp ≤ eval ≤ 600cp)

anastasiaMate.name: Anastasia's mate
anastasiaMate.description: A knight and rook or queen team up to trap the opposing king between the side of the board and a friendly piece.

arabianMate.name: Arabian mate
arabianMate.description: A knight and a rook team up to trap the opposing king on a corner of the board.

attackingF2F7.name: Attacking f2 or f7
attackingF2F7.description: An attack focusing on the f2 or f7 pawn, such as in the fried liver opening.

attraction.name: Attraction
attraction.description: An exchange or sacrifice encouraging or forcing an opponent piece to a square that allows a follow-up tactic.

backRankMate.name: Back rank mate
backRankMate.description: Checkmate the king on the home rank, when it is trapped there by its own pieces.

bishopEndgame.name: Bishop endgame
bishopEndgame.description: An endgame with only bishops and pawns.

bodenMate.name: Boden's mate
bodenMate.description: Two attacking bishops on criss-crossing diagonals deliver mate to a king obstructed by friendly pieces.

castling.name: Castling
castling.description: Bring the king to safety, and deploy the rook for attack.

capturingDefender.name: Capture the defender
capturingDefender.description: Removing a piece that is critical to defence of another piece, allowing the now undefended piece to be captured on a following move.

crushing.name: Crushing
crushing.description: Spot the opponent blunder to obtain a crushing advantage. (eval ≥ 600cp)

doubleBishopMate.name: Double bishop mate
doubleBishopMate.description: Two attacking bishops on adjacent diagonals deliver mate to a king obstructed by friendly pieces.

dovetailMate.name: Dovetail mate
dovetailMate.description: A queen delivers mate to an adjacent king, whose only two escape squares are obstructed by friendly pieces.

equality.name: Equality
equality.description: Come back from a losing position, and secure a draw or a balanced position. (eval ≤ 200cp)

kingsideAttack.name: Kingside attack
kingsideAttack.description: An attack of the opponent's king, after they castled on the king side.

clearance.name: Clearance
clearance.description: A move, often with tempo, that clears a square, file or diagonal for a follow-up tactical idea.

defensiveMove.name: Defensive move
defensiveMove.description: A precise move or sequence of moves that is needed to avoid losing material or another advantage.

deflection.name: Deflection
deflection.description: A move that distracts an opponent piece from another duty that it performs, such as guarding a key square. Sometimes also called "overloading".

discoveredAttack.name: Discovered attack
discoveredAttack.description: Moving a piece (such as a knight), that previously blocked an attack by a long range piece (such as a rook), out of the way of that piece.

doubleCheck.name: Double check
doubleCheck.description: Checking with two pieces at once, as a result of a discovered attack where both the moving piece and the unveiled piece attack the opponent's king.

endgame.name: Endgame
endgame.description: A tactic during the last phase of the game.

exposedKing.name: Exposed king
exposedKing.description: A tactic involving a king with few defenders around it, often leading to checkmate.

fork.name: Fork
fork.description: A move where the moved piece attacks two opponent pieces at once.

hangingPiece.name: Hanging piece
hangingPiece.description: A tactic involving an opponent piece being undefended or insufficiently defended and free to capture.

hookMate.name: Hook mate
hookMate.description: Checkmate with a rook, knight, and pawn along with one enemy pawn to limit the enemy king's escape.

interference.name: Interference
interference.description: Moving a piece between two opponent pieces to leave one or both opponent pieces undefended, such as a knight on a defended square between two rooks.

intermezzo.name: Intermezzo
intermezzo.description: Instead of playing the expected move, first interpose another move posing an immediate threat that the opponent must answer. Also known as "Zwischenzug" or "In between".

knightEndgame.name: Knight endgame
knightEndgame.description: An endgame with only knights and pawns.

master.name: Master games
master.description: Puzzles from games played by titled players.

masterVsMaster.name: Master vs Master games
masterVsMaster.description: Puzzles from games between two titled players.

mateIn5.name: Mate in 5 or more
mateIn5.description: Figure out a long mating sequence.

middlegame.name: Middlegame
middlegame.description: A tactic during the second phase of the game.

oneMove.name: One-move puzzle
oneMove.description: A puzzle that is only one move long.

opening.name: Opening
opening.description: A tactic during the first phase of the game.

pin.name: Pin
pin.description: A tactic involving pins, where a piece is unable to move without revealing an attack on a higher value piece.

promotion.name: Promotion
promotion.description: Promote one of your pawn to a queen or minor piece.

queenEndgame.name: Queen endgame
queenEndgame.description: An endgame with only queens and pawns.

queenRookEndgame.name: Queen and Rook
queenRookEndgame.description: An endgame with only queens, rooks and pawns.

queensideAttack.name: Queenside attack
queensideAttack.description: An attack of the opponent's king, after they castled on the queen side.

quietMove.name: Quiet move
quietMove.description: A move that does neither make a check or capture, nor an immediate threat to capture, but does prepare a more hidden unavoidable threat for a later move.

rookEndgame.name: Rook endgame
rookEndgame.description: An endgame with only rooks and pawns.

sacrifice.name: Sacrifice
sacrifice.description: A tactic involving giving up material in the short-term, to gain an advantage again after a forced sequence of moves.

skewer.name: Skewer
skewer.description: A motif involving a high value piece being attacked, moving out the way, and allowing a lower value piece behind it to be captured or attacked, the inverse of a pin.

smotheredMate.name: Smothered mate
smotheredMate.description: A checkmate delivered by a knight in which the mated king is unable to move because it is surrounded (or smothered) by its own pieces.

superGM.name: Super GM games
superGM.description: Puzzles from games played by the best players in the world.

trappedPiece.name: Trapped piece
trappedPiece.description: A piece is unable to escape capture as it has limited moves.

underPromotion.name: Underpromotion
underPromotion.description: Promotion to a knight, bishop, or rook.

veryLong.name: Very long puzzle
veryLong.description: Four moves or more to win.

xRayAttack.name: X-Ray attack
xRayAttack.description: A piece attacks or defends a square, through an enemy piece.

zugzwang.name: Zugzwang
zugzwang.description: The opponent is limited in the moves they can make, and all moves worsen their position.
